title: Beer-loving office worker figures out genius ways to get free drinks
text:
This man deserves a raise (even if it’s just of a glass).

An office worker in Grand Rapids, Mich., has a very effective way of getting free drinks. The best part is, apparently he gets all the beverages while he’s at work.

Diners at New Holland Brewing’s Knickerbocker have noticed a sign hanging from a third-floor office in the same building as the restaurant, Fox 17 reports. The sign, which reportedly stands several feet tall, says: “Please send beer to Sam on floor 3. Thank you!”

The third-floor office is rented out by Media Place Partners, an advertising agency.

NATURAL LIGHT'S HALLOWEEN COSTUME CONTEST OFFERS CASH TO THOSE WHO DRESS LIKE ADULT 'SCARIES'

And that sign? Well, it seems to work.

According to the general manager of the Knickerbocker, Eli Harper, more than a few customers have indulged the office worker.

"We keep the score updated there at 85,” Harper told Fox 17. “That's the current count of gifts he’s had in about a year. So, he’s saving some money! It's a fun story that kind of lives within beer city and I think everyone around here appreciates getting a beer purchased for them every once in a while.”

CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP

The famous Sam from the sign is said to be Sam Hoats, who works as a senior digital strategist at Media Place Partners. He claims to have been inspired to make the sign while seeing advertisements while watching a soccer game.

Hoats told Fox 17, “So I’m looking up at where my desk is and thinking, Man, could I angle some text and make it readable?'”

Since the success of the sign, Harper claims that the restaurant might introduce a “Third Floor Sam” brew over the next few months.
description: This man deserves a raise (even if it’s just a toast).
